qas.question: What market did Dell ignore at first?
When did Dell's internet site gain popularity?
What was happening to Dell's average sale to individuals?
When did Dell create their internal marketing group?
What market did Dell appease at first?
What market did IBM ignore at first?
When did Dell's internet site lose popularity?
What was happening to IBM's average sale to individuals?
When did Dell end their internal marketing group?

context: Originally, Dell did not emphasize the <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>consumer market<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, due to the higher costs and unacceptably low profit margins in selling to individuals and households; this changed when the company’s Internet site took off in <a1_0><b6_0>1996<a1_0/> and 1997<b6_0/>. While the industry’s average selling price to individuals was going down, Dell's was <a2_0><b7_0>going up<b7_0/><a2_0/>, as second- and third-time computer buyers who wanted powerful computers with multiple features and did not need much technical support were choosing Dell. Dell found an opportunity among PC-savvy individuals who liked the convenience of buying direct, customizing their PC to their means, and having it delivered in days. In early <a3_0><b8_0>1997<b8_0/><a3_0/>, Dell created an internal sales and marketing group dedicated to serving the home market and introduced a product line designed especially for individual users.
